title: Patterson v. State
text:

   "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

THIS OPINION HAS NO PRECEDENTIAL VALUE.Â  IT SHOULD NOT BE CITED OR
    RELIED ON AS PRECEDENT IN ANY PROCEEDING EXCEPT AS PROVIDED BY RULE 268(d)(2),
    SCACR.
THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA
In The Supreme Court


  
    
      
        Curtis
          Patterson, Petitioner,
        v.
        State of South
          Carolina, Respondent.
      
    
  


  ON WRIT OF CERTIORARI

  Appeal from Aiken County
  Costa M. Pleicones, Plea Judge
  Â Doyet A. Early, III, Post-Conviction
  Judge

  Memorandum Opinion No.Â  2011-MO-031
    Submitted November 16, 2011 â€“ Filed
  November 21, 2011Â  

  DISMISSED AS IMPROVIDENTLY GRANTED


  
    
      
        Appellate Defender Kathrine H. Hudgins, of South
          Carolina Commission on Indigent Defense, of Columbia, for Petitioner.
        Attorney General Alan Wilson, Chief Deputy Attorney
          General John W. McIntosh, Assistant Deputy Attorney General Salley W. Elliott,
          and Assistant Attorney General Mary S. Williams, all of Columbia, for
          Respondent.
      
    
  

  
  PER CURIAM:Â  Â Â  We granted a writ of certiorari to
    review the denial of Petitioner's application for post-conviction relief
(PCR).Â  We now dismiss the writ as improvidently granted. 
  DISMISSED
  AS IMPROVIDENTLY GRANTED.
  TOAL,
    C.J., BEATTY, KITTREDGE and HEARN, JJ., concur.Â  PLEICONES, J., not
    participating.

title: Wyatt v. State
text:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
   "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">



<!-- meta anti cache-->
 



<!--
body{
font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
}
P.heading {
text-align:center
}
-->



THIS OPINION HAS NO PRECEDENTIAL VALUE.  IT SHOULD NOT
  BE CITED OR RELIED ON AS PRECEDENT IN ANY PROCEEDING EXCEPT AS PROVIDED BY RULE
  268(d)(2), SCACR.
THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA
In The Supreme Court

  
    
      
        Richard Warner
          Wyatt, Petitioner,
        v.
        State of South
          Carolina, Respondent.
      
    
  


Appeal From Greenville County
Â J. Mark Hayes, II, Circuit Court Judge

Memorandum Opinion No.Â Â Â  2011-MO-032
  Submitted November 16, 2011 â€“ Filed
November 21, 2011

AFFIRMED


  
    
      
        Appellate Defender LaNelle C. DuRant, of South Carolina Commission
          on Indigent Defense, Division of Appellate Defense, of Columbia, for
          Petitioner.
        Attorney General Alan Wilson, Chief Deputy Attorney General John
          W. McIntosh, Assistant Deputy Attorney General Salley Elliott, and Assistant Attorney General Karen Ratigan, Office of the Attorney
          General, of Columbia, for Respondent.

    
  


PER CURIAM:Â 
  In this post-conviction relief case, we granted a writ of certiorari to provide
  petitioner with a belated review of his direct appeal issues pursuant to White
    v. State, 263 S.C. 110, 208 S.E.2d 35 (1974). Â We now affirm petitionerâ€™s
  conviction and sentence pursuant to Rule 220(b)(1), SCACR, and the following
  authorities: Issue 1: Â Batson v. Kentucky, 476 U.S. 79 (1986); State v. Rayfield, 369 S.C. 106, 631 S.E.2d 244 (2006); State
    v. Haigler, 334 S.C. 623, 515 S.E.2d 88 (1999); Issue 2:Â  Rule 403, SCRE;
  Rule 609(a)(1), SCRE; State
    v. Bryant, 369 S.C. 511,
  633 S.E.2d 152 (2006); State
    v. Clark, 315 S.C. 478,
  445 S.E.2d 633 (1994).
AFFIRMED.
TOAL,
  C.J., PLEICONES, BEATTY, KITTREDGE and HEARN, JJ., concur.

title: Jones v. State
text:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
   "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">



<!-- meta anti cache-->




<!--
body         { font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif }
p.heading    { text-align: center }
-->




THIS OPINION HAS NO
  PRECEDENTIAL VALUE.  IT SHOULD NOT BE CITED OR RELIED ON AS PRECEDENT IN
  ANY PROCEEDING EXCEPT AS PROVIDED BY RULE 268(d)(2), SCACR.
THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA
In The Supreme Court


  
    
      
        Demetrius
          Jones, Petitioner,
      
    
  

v.

  
    
      
        State of South
          Carolina, Respondent.
      
    
  


ON WRIT OF CERTIORARI

Appeal From Marion County
  Benjamin H. Culbertson, Circuit Court
Judge

Memorandum Opinion No.Â  2011-MO-033
  Submitted November 16, 2011 - Filed
November 28, 2011Â  

DISMISSED AS IMPROVIDENTLY GRANTED


  
    
      
        Appellate Defender LaNelle C. DuRant, of the South
          Carolina Commission on Indigent Defense, of Columbia, for Petitioner.
        Attorney General Alan Wilson, Chief Deputy Attorney
          General John W. McIntosh, Assistant Deputy Attorney General Salley W. Elliott, and
          Senior Assistant Attorney General David Spencer, all of Columbia, for
          Respondent.
      
    
  


PER CURIAM:Â  Demetrius Jones pled guilty to voluntary manslaughter,
  armed robbery, and assault and battery of a high and aggravated nature
  (ABHAN).Â  He was sentenced to twenty-five years' imprisonment for voluntary
  manslaughter and armed robbery, respectively, and to ten years' imprisonment
  for ABHAN.Â  The sentences were to be served concurrently.Â  No direct appeal was
  taken.Â  Jones filed an application for post-conviction relief (PCR) in which he
  claimed his plea counsel had an actual conflict of interest as he
  simultaneously represented another co-defendant on the same charges.Â  This
  Court granted Jones's petition for a writ of certiorari to review a circuit
  court order denying his PCR application.Â  We
  now dismiss the writ of certiorari as improvidently granted.
DISMISSED.
TOAL, C.J.,
  PLEICONES, BEATTY, KITTREDGE and HEARN, JJ., concur.
